Text: Hehe, that was a lot of fun. Where shall we go next?
Ah, so this is where you ran off to.

Oh, hey, Elisabeth. How was your tour of the food
stands? Find anything yummy?

After the sculpted candy, I sampled a dish called
"okonomiyaki," The aroma of the sauce was to die
for... It was everything I ever wanted.

Oh yeah, you're preaching to the choir. The sauce
they use in those flour dishes is awesome. Sometimes
I can hardly stop myself from eating more.

Hehe, it certainly sounds like you used your time to
the fullest. Would you care to join us at the next
stand?

Oh, is that an invitation? How delightful. Where were
you planning to visit next?

...Uh, hey, aren't you guys forgetting the real
mission here?
Are we not enjoying the festival?
Um, that's not what I mean.

Hehe, yes, yes, I know. Our goal here is to guide the
souls of the deceased... But there's something I
want to do first.

Something you want to do...? Other than checking out
the stalls?
I was hoping I might have another duel with Violet.

Dear me, now that is interesting. I would be honored
to grant your request.
Uh, how did we end up here...?

(As I recall...these two both have pretty wild
fighting styles.)

Hey, if you go at it here, it won't be a festival
anymore. And we'd probably end up with a lot more
dead folks, too.
Heehee, oh, don't be silly.
This is the perfect stage.

Now, how about we settle this with some goldfish
scooping?

What a marvelous idea. That stand did catch my eye
earlier.
...Well, I guess that'd be okay.

(But these two are definitely losing sight of the big
picture...)

Okay, let's go over the rules. The winner is whoever
catches the most fish with three paper scoops. No
interference allowed. Are we clear?
I have no objections.
Me neither.
Alright, then let the game...begin!

Now, my fishy friends clad in pretty gold...I beseech
you to aid me in my hour of need. If you would kindly
come this waâ€”AH!
Uh-oh, it ripped.

I suppose the trick is to snatch them up quickly,
before the scoop tears. Just keep my aim steady
and...oh.
Looks like yours ripped, too.

I know better than most that nothing is certain in
life...but these scoops are so thin, so weak, so
fickle. I must be careful with my remaining two...

Perhaps I was a touch too hasty. I'll get it right
next time...

(While they're so into it, maybe I'll go get in some
ghost-busting.)

Nice and quiet, so the fish don't notice... Oh no.
Another blunder.

What, no?! It tore right through the scoop and swam
away...
Having a spot of trouble, are we?
I could say the same for you.
...Say, Violet. I have a proposal.

What a coincidence. I was about to make a proposal to
you as well. I'm sure we must be on the same train of
thought.
Okay, that's that. I swept that area...
How's it going? Do we have a winner?

See for yourself. Neither of us caught a single fish.
...Which I suppose means we have a draw.

This does not make for a proper contest, but most
importantly we aren't enjoying the game.

Say, good sir. Won't you teach us the secret of how
to play?
Oh... Okay, I think I get the picture.

(Turns out they're both more easy-going than I
thought. But, whatever, looks like they're having a
good time.)
Alright, I can give you some pointers.
We're counting on you, professor.
...Can you drop the professor part?

Come, good sir. Stop being bashful and commence with
the lesson, if you would.
Okay, okay. Now, the first thing is toâ€”
